snippet: Msgr. Kevin Wallin, a suspended priest, also bought a video- and sex-toy shop in North Haven, Conn., apparently to launder drug money, the authorities said.
abstract: Msgr Kevin Wallin, suspended Roman Catholic priest in Bridgeport, Conn, who was accused of selling more than $300,000 worth of methamphetamine from his apartment, pleads guilty to federal drug charge; Wallin is scheduled to be sentenced on June 25 to agreed-upon sentence of 11 to 14 years.
lead_paragraph: Msgr. Kevin Wallin, a suspended priest, also bought a video- and sex-toy shop in North Haven, Conn., apparently to launder drug money, the authorities said.

headline.seo: Connecticut Priest Pleads Guilty to Plot to Sell Methamphetamine
headline.main: Priest Pleads Guilty to Charges Involving Methamphetamine Sales
headline.print_headline: Priest Pleads Guilty to Charges Involving Methamphetamine Sales
